quote: I come from a long line of body snatchers, probably the top-notch body snatchers in America. No make that the world. Some people might think it's gross digging up bones or corpses, but who asked them? It's no big deal, but then I've been doing it since I got out of diapers.
author: Minda Webber
tags: dracula, frankenstein, ghouls, grave-robbers, monsters, vampires, van-helsing, werewolves

quote: I don't know if i can," I said, looking up into Archer's eyes. "Honestly, Archer....I'm tired of being scared, tired of loving you on one hand and hating you on the other.
author: J.L. McCoy, The Original Sin

quote: Vampires were myths, childhood stories– as were werewolves, mermaids and dragons. I believed none of it.
author: Ashley Madau
tags: childhood-stories, dragon, dragons, mermaid-romance, mermaids, morningside, myths, vampire, vampires, werewolf, werewolves

quote: Tied to the physical, deaf to the eternal, riveted by my own shortcomings, I was thinking only of what a bad choice I'd made when choosing a partner for a chat. This guy was faking timidity to lure someone over. If I said victim, he was likely to start gnawing my neck. If I said vampire, he would demand proof. I hadn't the fangs enough to back that pretension.
author: Christine Wicker, Not In Kansas Anymore

quote: This isn’t the girl I fell in love with. My sweet, giving, patient, loving, caring, fun-loving Skye disappeared when you were kidnapped. I’m so scared I’ll never get her back.
author: J.L. McCoy, The Original Sin

quote: If a faerie, a vampire, and a demon walk into a bar, you wait for the punch line. At Private Eye, when a faerie, a vampire, and a demon walk through the door, it’s just another day at the office.
author: E.J. Stevens, Blood and Mistletoe

quote: You guys just aren’t fair, between your vampire pheromones and your gorgeous good looks, we humans just don’t stand a chance.
author: J.L. McCoy, The Original Sin

quote: I've had a few intense arguments with my boss who happens to be the object of my sexual fantasies.
author: J.L. McCoy, The Original Sin

quote: I’m coming, you impatient old coot! Keep your panties on!”-Skye yelling back to Hagan.
author: J.L. McCoy, The Original Sin

quote: Because, my dear Eric, I have tasted the secret knowledge. I know how much to say and when to pull back. I know what to see and not see. And now that I have become whole again, I can never go back. All these things he has given me. Better than my supposed mother and father ever could. For that, I owe him my life and allegiance.
author: Melika Dannese Lux, Corcitura
tags: corcitura, eric-bradburry, hybrid-vampires, revelations, secret-knowledge, secrets, shocking-secrets, stefan-belododia, stefan-ratliff, vampires, vampires-in-venice, venice

quote: Make no excuses for the devils that will not excuse you of their burdens, Miss Crane." - Darien Nicodemeus; Chapter Sixteen - The Giant's Return
author: S.C. Parris, The Immortal's Guide
tags: darien-nicodemeus, excuses, inspirational, lillith-crane, the-immortal-s-guide, vampires

quote: How does one go on after doing such unspeakable things? It'sall rather simple, really," he continued, speaking in someone else's voice. "Say to yourself, 'What things?' And it becomes clear...you are blameless. They brought it on themselves. What have they ever done for you except control your life? They tore you away from your sister; they ripped you from your home. Did you ask to be saved? No! Forget them and start over...with us, your true family, my Corcitura, my own.
author: Melika Dannese Lux, Corcitura
tags: corcitura, hybrid-vampires, interior-struggle, menace, power-struggle, vampires, vladec-salei

quote: With bells on babe" Dean purred sexily and hung up.
author: J.L. McCoy, The Original Sin

quote: Just because you don't know how to do something doesn't mean it can't be done.
author: Jeaniene Frost, At Grave's End

quote: I worry that when you start quoting Machiavelli to justify your actions, you have ceased to be one of the good guys.
author: Laurell K. Hamilton, Bullet

quote: Common courtesy dictates that we never drain the lifeblood of anyone to whom we've been formally introduced.
author: Kelley Armstrong, Stolen

quote: No idea how you figured out the riddle, but you scooped the first prize. Congratulations. You've just won a vacation to a big, relaxing place called a grave.
author: Jayde Scott

quote: I'm not the one going for a biology degree. I'm just a philosophy major who eats people.
author: Scott Westerfeld, Peeps
tags: cannibalism, funny, humor, parasites, vampires, zombies

quote: Lestat: Toughen up baby. I'm looking for the eternal scum.
author: Anne Rice

quote: There were glowing pumpkins and ghost lights in the yard and cheerful looking spiders and vampire posters everywhere.  “This is just disgusting,” Abel said in disgust, landing on a happy mummy poster staked in the yard.  “Must everything be commercialized these days?  I’m surprised the vampires don’t sparkle.
author: John H. Carroll, Unholy Cow

quote: Lestat: You're very anxious to be out of these rooms, aren't you? Why don't we simply get into bed together? I don't understand.David: You're serious?Lestat: Of courseDavid: You do realize, that this is an absolutely magnificent body, don't you? I mean you aren't insensible to the fact that you've been deposited in a...a most impressive piece of young male flesh.Lestat: I looked it over well before the switch, remember? Why is it you don't want to..David: You've been with a woman, haven't you?Lestat: I wish you hadn't read my mind. It's rude. Besides, what does that matter to you?David: A woman you loved.Lestat: I have always loved both men and women.David: That's a slightly different use of the word 'love.
author: Anne Rice
tags: anne-rice, lestat-de-lioncourt, louis-pointe-du-lac, tales-of-the-body-thief, vampire-chronicles, vampires

quote: I had to wonder, though, if there's something about a murderer, particularly a confident one, that gives him a certain charisma or charm that I, in particular, am susceptible to.I mean, there's a reason more women are attracted to Dracula than repelled by him.I made a resolution to myself. From now on, I'd assume that every man I was attracted to was a murderer until proven otherwise.Perhaps it wasn't the most promising strategy for starting a relationship, but I might live longer.
author: Lee Goldberg, Mr. Monk on the Couch
tags: attraction, charisma, dating, dracula, murder, murderer, serial-killers, vampires

quote: I happen to be partial to humans - most, anyway. Clowns, not so much. Those evil bastards never stop smiling.
author: Mimi Jean Pamfiloff, Accidentally Married to...a Vampire?

quote: Do you think the Devil is real then?” she asked. If God wasn’t up in heaven answering a desperate mother’s prayers then maybe Satan didn’t exist either.“He is real,” Gabriel answered quietly, his voice almost a whisper. “I look him in the eye every day.
author: Evangeline Ravencraft, Fallen

quote: I touched the small sacred images. I shook my head and bit my lip, as if to say, How awful that he should have stolen these! But I also found it very funny. And further proof that God had no power over me.
author: Anne Rice, The Vampire Lestat

quote: Lestat: I despise you! I ought to destroy you-finish what I started when I made you. Turn you into ashes and sift them through my hands. You know that I could do it! Like that! Like the snap of mortal fingers, I could do it. Burn you as I burnt your little house. And nothing could save you, nothing at all.
author: Anne Rice

quote: The Shrink always warned me that carriers stay wracked with lifelong guilt. It's not an uplifting thing having turned lovers into monsters. We feel bad that we haven't turned into monsters ourselves--survivor's guilt, that's called. And we feel a bit stupid that we didn't notice our own symptoms earlier. I mean, I'd been sort of wondering why the Atkins diet was giving me night vision. But that hadn't seemed like something to worry about...
author: Scott Westerfeld, Peeps
tags: contagion, funny, guilt, humor, ombies, parasites, vampires

quote: Ranerio wrapped his hand around mine, guiding my fingers like Lucius had done when he'd shown me the latch behind the dressing-room door mirror. But while the warrior I loved had been offering me an escape route, the pacifist was trying to show me how to fight.
author: Beth Fantaskey, Jessica Rules the Dark Side

quote: I feel like I'm forgetting something. Vyrus. Clans. Zombies. Stay out of the sun. Don't get shot. Abandon your life. Drink blood to survive. No, guess that pretty much covers it.
author: Charlie Huston, Every Last Drop

quote: Vampires, bringing America together!
author: Charlaine Harris, Dead in the Family

quote: Vampires don't tan. Without UV protection, we get sunburned, heal, and just repeat the process over and over.” — Spade, First Drop of Crimson by Jeaniene Frost
author: Jeaniene Frost

quote: What’s ‘at supposed tae mean?” He asked insulted.“Everyone always has an ulterior motive.” I replied.“Well I dinnae, an’ I’m nae claimin’ tae be innocent. I was lookin’ fur ye, as per yer mother’s request. Nae hidden agenda here!” He said sternly. “Besides, if I wanted ye dead, you’d be dead.” He stressed out the last part.
author: S.L. Ross

quote: Vampirism is not a contagious disease.
author: Alex   Taylor, The Wannabe Vampire

quote: I took a deep breath and listened to the old brag of my heart. I am, I am, I am.
author: Sylvia Plath, The Bell Jar

quote: It isn't by getting out of the world that we become enlightened, but by getting into the world…by getting so tuned in that we can ride the waves of our existence and never get tossed because we become the waves.
author: Ken Kesey, Kesey's Garage Sale

quote: Finally, she mused that human existence is as brief as the life of autumn grass, so what was there to fear from taking chances with your life?
author: Mo Yan, Red Sorghum

quote: There are only two worlds - your world, which is the real world, and other worlds, the fantasy. Worlds like this are worlds of the human imagination: their reality, or lack of reality, is not important. What is important is that they are there. these worlds provide an alternative. Provide an escape. Provide a threat. Provide a dream, and power; provide refuge, and pain. They give your world meaning. They do not exist; and thus they are all that matters.
author: Neil Gaiman, The Books of Magic

quote: Monsters exist, but they are too few in number to be truly dangerous. More dangerous are the common men, the functionaries ready to believe and to act without asking questions.
author: Primo Levi
tags: common-men, danger, existence, holocaust, monsters, questions

quote: Let us proceed under the assumption that the fairy folk do exist, and that I am not a gibbering moron.
author: Eoin Colfer, Artemis Fowl

quote: I exist, that is all, and I find it nauseating.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre, Being and Nothingness

quote: When it occurs to a man that nature does not regard him as important, and that she feels she would not maim the universe by disposing of him, he at first wishes to throw bricks at the temple, and he hates deeply the fact that there are no bricks and no temples.
author: Stephen Crane, The Open Boat

quote: Perhaps the most terrible (or wonderful) thing that can happen to an imaginative youth, aside from the curse (or blessing) of imagination itself, is to be exposed without preparation to the life outside his or her own sphere - the sudden revelation that there is a there out there.
author: Tom Robbins, Jitterbug Perfume

quote: AGE DIFFERENCEWhat if I told you that one day you will meet a girl who is unlike anyone else you've known. She will know all the right things to say, what makes you laugh, what turns you on, what drives you wild and best of all, you will do for her exactly what she does for you."When will I meet her?"Well let's put it this way, she doesn't even exist yet.
author: Lang Leav

quote: It was a source of both terror and comfort to me then that I often seemed invisible — incompletely and minimally existent, in fact. It seemed to me that I made no impact on the world, and that in exchange I was privileged to watch it unawares.
author: Marilynne Robinson, Housekeeping

quote: If there was one weapon he had against these savages, it was not acknowledging their existence.
author: Melina Marchetta, Finnikin of the Rock

quote: I kept running around it in large or small circles, always looking for someone or something able to convince me of my Belovedness.Self-rejection is the greatest enemy of the spiritual life because it contradicts the sacred voice that calls us the "Beloved". Being the Beloved expresses the core truth of our existence.
author: Henri J.M. Nouwen, Life of the Beloved: Spiritual Living in a Secular World

quote: Here, fire turns into water;Here, the dancing of the rain declares the sun.There's no opposition in existence, no contradiction;Everything supports everything else.
author: Osho

quote: Anything, anything to stop drowning in this dull, trivial and cowardly existence.
author: Charles Bukowski, Ham on Rye

quote: Not the power to remember, but its very opposite, the power to forget, is a necessary condition for our existence.
author: Sholem Asch

quote: We are born to Exist, not to know, to be, not to assert ourselves.
author: Emil M. Cioran

quote: Assessing existence while failing to embrace the insights of modern physics would be like wrestling in the dark with an unknown opponent.
author: Brian Greene

quote: If an overgrown child draws something on a piece of paper, you can't ask the paper what the drawing is supposed to represent.
author: Jostein Gaarder, Sophie's World

quote: Since the Renaissance, people have had to get used to living their life on a random planet in the vast galaxy.
author: Jostein Gaarder, Sophie's World

quote: The existence of a majority logically implies a corresponding minority.
author: Philip K. Dick, The Minority Report

quote: Photographers deal in things which are continually vanishing and when they have vanished there is no contrivance on earth which can make them come back again.
author: Henri Cartier-Bresson

quote: ...I take as a point of departure the possibility and desirability of a fundamentally different form of society--call it communism, if you will--in which men and women, freed from the pressures of scarcity and from the insecurity of everyday existence under capitalism, shape their own lives. Collectively they decide who, how, when, and what shall be produced.
author: Michael Burawoy, Manufacturing Consent: Changes in the Labor Process Under Monopoly Capitalism
tags: capitalism, collective, communism, existence, marxism, neo-marxism, socialism, sociology, utopia

quote: You were right," said the Master impressed by the neatness of Korovyov's work, "when you said: no documents, no person. So that means I don't exist since I don't have any documents.
author: Mikhail Bulgakov, The Master and Margarita

quote: The most fundamental tragedy of my life is that the ones who I see do not existand the one who exists I do not see.
author: Kedar Joshi

quote: Love is the linchpin that connects the material world with higher levels of existence.
author: Julianne Davidow

quote: Norah watched him, serious and utterly absorbed in his task, overcome by the simple fact of his existence.
author: Kim Edwards, The Memory Keeper's Daughter

quote: Leaving a place, a person or a country silently and without any notice is a heroic and a noble way of teaching the importance of your presence to those who ignore your existence!
author: Mehmet Murat ildan
tags: country, existence, ignore, ildan-words-of-wisdom, leave, leaving, noble, person, place, presence, teaching

quote: Have patience with all things but first with yourself. Never confuse your mistakes with your value as a human being. You are perfectly valuable, creative, worthwhile person simply because you exist. And no amount of triumphs or tribulations can ever change that.
author: Saint Frances de Sales
tags: creative, existence, mistake, patience, perfect, triumph, valuable, worthwhile

quote: I felt myself being invaded through and through, I crumbled, disintegrated, and only emptiness remained.
author: Stanisław Lem, Solaris by Stanislaw Lem | Summary & Study Guide

quote: Whatever begins to exist has a cause.
author: Glenn Meade, The Second Messiah

quote: The only time "early bloomer" has ever been applied to me is vis-a-vis my premature apprehension of the deep dread-of-existence thing. In all other cases, I plod and tromp along. My knuckles? Well dragged.
author: Colson Whitehead, Sag Harbor

quote: It is natural that people should differ most, and most violently, about the unknowable . . . There is all the room in the world for divergence of opinion about something that, so far as we can realistically perceive, does not exist.
author: E. Haldeman-Julius
tags: differ, divergence, existence, natural, opinion, perception, unknowable, violence

quote: The West Indian is not exactly hostile to change, but he is not much inclined to believe in it. This comes from a piece of wisdom that his climate of eternal summer teaches him. It is that, under all the parade of human effort and noise, today is like yesterday, and tomorrow will be like today; that existence is a wheel of recurring patterns from which no one escapes; that all anybody does in this life is live for a while and then die for good, without finding out much; and that therefore the idea is to take things easy and enjoy the passing time under the sun. The white people charging hopefully around the islands these days in the noon glare, making deals, bulldozing airstrips, hammering up hotels, laying out marinas, opening new banks, night clubs, and gift shops, are to him merely a passing plague. They have come before and gone before.
author: Herman Wouk, Don't Stop the Carnival
tags: caribbean, existence, life, modernity, summer, tropics, west-indies

quote: Remember all ye that existence is pure joy
author: that all the sorrows are but as shadows

quote: Happiness isn't something she spends much time thinking about. Survival, discomfort, hunger...these are the concerns that fill her days.
author: David Maine, Fallen

quote: When you look more generally at life on Earth, you find that it is all the same kind of life. There are not many different kinds; there's only one kind. It uses about fifty fundamental biological building blocks, organic molecules.
author: Carl Sagan, The Varieties of Scientific Experience: A Personal View of the Search for God
tags: biology, building-blocks, earth, existence, life, molecules

quote: It's idiotic, it's crazy. If you die and then you're just nothing, there isn't any point to anything. Why do we live at all if we die and stop being? Father wasn't ready to be stopped. No one's ready to be stopped. We don't have *time* to be ready to be stopped. It's all crazy. . . . Look at my glasses. I can't even see that there are any stars in the sky without them, but it's not the glasses that are doing the seeing, it's me, Madeleine. I don't think Father's eyes are seeing now, but *he* is. And maybe his brain isn't thinking, but a brain's just something to think through, the way my glasses are something to see through.
author: Madeleine L'Engle, The Summer of the Great-Grandmother

quote: Savor your existence. Live every moment. Do not waste a breath.
author: Nando Parrado, Miracle in the Andes

quote: But “nowhere” does not mean nothing; rather, region in general lies therein, and disclosedness of the world in general for essentially spatial being-in. Therefore, what is threatening cannot come closer from a definite direction within nearness, it is already “there” - and yet nowhere. It is so near that it is oppressive and takes one’s breath - and yet it is nowhere.
author: Martin Heidegger, Being and Time

quote: There are moments, such as the one that oppresses me now, when I feel my own self far more than I feel external things, and everything transforms into a night of rain and mud where, lost in the solitude of an out-of-the-way station, I wait interminably for the next third-class train.
author: Fernando Pessoa, The Book of Disquiet

quote: Man’s guilt in history and in the tides of his own blood has been complicated by technology, the daily seeping falsehearted death.
author: Don DeLillo, White Noise

quote: Just existing is where a lot of living happens.
author: Fred Gallagher
tags: existence, fred-gallagher, gallagher, life, megatokyo, webcomics

quote: How did I make a living? I haven't. I have eked out an existence." - Ella Baker
author: Gail Collins, When Everything Changed: The Amazing Journey of American Women from 1960 to the Present
tags: civil-rights, ella-baker, existence, life, naacp, volunteer, women-s-rights

quote: Occasionally I glanced at the big blue cradle of civilization hanging in the sky, remembered for the fiftieth or sixtieth or one hundredth time that none of this had any right to be happening, and reminded myself for the fiftieth or sixtieth or one hundredth time that the only sane response was to continue carrying the tune.
author: Adam-Troy Castro, Alien Contact

quote: Maps codify the miracle of existence.
author: Nicholas Crane, Mercator: The Man Who Mapped the Planet

quote: I murmur: "It's a seat," a little like an exorcism. But the word stays on my lips: it refuses to go and put itself on the thing. It stays what it is, with its red plush, thousands of little red paws in the air, all still, little dead paws. This enormous belly turned upward, bleeding, inflated—bloated with all its dead paws, this belly floating in this car, in this grey sky, is not a seat. It could just as well be a dead donkey tossed about in the water, floating with the current, belly in the air in a great grey river, a river of floods; and I could be sitting on the donkey's belly, my feet dangling in the clear water.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre, Nausea

quote: The man who has a library of his own collection is able to contemplate himself objectively, and is justified in believing in his own existence.
author: Augustine Birrell

quote: free fall to your quite smile to capture you and you propel me to death, all that we write destroys then heals
author: Gwen Calvo

quote: Being, as the basic theme of philosophy, is no class or genus of entities; yet it pertains to every entity. Its 'universality' is to be sought higher up. Being and the structure of Being lie beyond every entity and every possible character which an entity may possess. *Being is a transcendens pure and simple*. And the transcendence of Dasein's Being is distinctive in that it implies the possibility and the necessity of the most radical *individuation*. Every disclosure of Being as the *transcendens* is *transcendental* knowledge. *Phenomenological truth (the disclosedness of Being) is veritas transcendentalis*.Ontology and phenomenology are not two distinct philosophical disciplines among others. These terms characterize philosophy itself with regard to its object and its way of treating that object. Philosophy is universal phenomenological ontology, and takes its departure from the hermeneutic of Dasein, which, as an analytic of *existence*, has made fast the guide-line for all philosophical inquiry at the point where it *arises* and to which it *returns*."―from_Being and Time_. Translated by John Macquarrie & Edward Robinson, p. 62
author: Martin Heidegger
tags: being, existence, heidegger, metaphysics, ontology, phenomenology

quote: If what you want does not exist, why not create it?
author: Khang Kijarro Nguyen

quote: The Lord has made all things for Himself (Prov.xvi.4): apart from Himself there existed nothing to make them for. He made them for His own sake, for His own pleasure. But it was His pleasure to bring into existence things that could take pleasure in existence. For our sakes He made us for His sake. To us there is something mysterious in an altruism so total, but something exciting in the mystery. Among all the mysteries, many are greater, but it is hard to think of one more pleasing.
author: Frank Sheed, Theology and Sanity

quote: Actually there were only two forms of existence, I reflected: one that was tied to a place and one that wasn't. Both had always existed. Neither could be chosen.
author: Karl Ove Knausgård, Min kamp 5

quote: Consume life before it spoils.
author: Todd Crawshaw, Exploits of the Satyr

quote: In the vast spectrum of space-time’s coeternal continuum, I am but a glint of bundled energy held together by the translucent fiber of creative consciousness. The misty dew of private thoughts that inhabit my streaky underworld briefly forms a splintery part of the glittering arena of the cosmos. In the ether-like dawn of my awakening, my minuscule arch appears intravenously injected amid the dark matter of the nightscape. Reminiscent of the morning’s dew, my comet’s tailed reflection disintegrates and dissipates without a lasting trace in the dawn of a new age. I shall never wholly cease to exist, since my filtrate potentiality – a trace of my essence – remains suspended forevermore in celestial wonderment.
author: Kilroy J. Oldster, Dead Toad Scrolls
tags: creative-life, creative-living, death, death-quotations, death-quotes, dying, dying-last-words, dying-words, essence, existence, philosophical, philosphy-of-life

quote: I reach my object and say, Wander no more. All else is trial and make-believe.
author: Virginia Woolf, The Waves

quote: being is one day and a million nights. the blood on the glass, blood lust with the sun holding. the universe beats for the lost and found. with you.
author: Gwen Calvo, Cocaine Masks: Cocaine Masks

quote: The fish don't need to know why they're in the water.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The earth keeps turning but it never says why.
author: Marty Rubin
tags: being, existence, explanations, life, reasons, the-world

quote: And the existence is tedious, anyway; it is a senseless, dirty business, this life.
author: Anton Chekhov, Uncle Vanya

quote: It was if, in the process of its long and arduous journey from Afghanistan's mines to Europe's canvases, and its painful evolution from barren beginnings, ultramarine had collected and purified all the wisdom of the different worlds it traversed, retaining only what was common to then, and what was most important. This pure, clean color evokes undulating infinity, that delicate moment between day and night, an image of man constantly drifting between existence and non-existence.
author: Mileta Prodanović, Ultramarin: roman bez slika

quote: I suspect there is something in our very mode of thought which makes it inevitable that we should always be baffled by actual existence, whatever character actual existence may have.
author: C.S. Lewis, The Business of Heaven: Daily Readings from C. S. Lewis

quote: Even more, in the created thing, is a perfection that she exists; since the greatest of all imperfections is, not to exist.
author: Baruch Spinoza

quote: Seeing the skylines The heart becomes pensive and still; Mammoth is the world,Our existence…almost nil!
author: Neelam Saxena Chandra

quote: Philosophic questions are attempts to understand the root nature of reality, existence, and knowledge.
author: Kilroy J. Oldster, Dead Toad Scrolls
tags: existence, philosophic-questions, philosophic-quotes, philosophical-musings, philosophical-quote, philosophy, philosphy-of-life, q

quote: Our obsession for success, recognition and supremacy in all circumstances without ever aware of the gravity of the situation and the subtle intricacies that impact the fabric of the society as a whole has made us more inhuman than humanly possible, as a result we have become more artificial, with not even an iota of LIFE throbbing within Us. Humanity as a whole has come to this juncture, wherein if we don't dare to accept and act on our vulnerabilities, our shortcomings in totality and to embrace failures in same breath as success as an integral part of life, then I fear we are creating a world of zombies!
author: Ramana Pemmaraju
tags: acceptance-of-oneself, evolutionary-psychology, existence, live-totally, natural-living, nature-of-man

quote: How much dust can a body make? Little specks of death. Measuring life in millimeters.
author: Ryan Galloway, Biome

quote: To simply survive appears to be the choice of the plodding hoards that wander all around me. Therefore, I’ve adamantly committed to never hoard hoards.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
tags: abandon, abandonment, conform, conformity, exist, existence, hoard, hoards, mediocre, mediocrity, passive, surrender, surrendering, survival, survive, vision, visionless

quote: Isn't Existence is the only thing that make us feel as ONE.
author: Pawan Parashar

quote: They had nothing in common except for existing in the same time and space
author: Pascal Garnier, Too Close to the Edge

quote: Lucifer endears himself to us only as the Lord of Lies, for in this role he is most convincing as a character, which is to say, as a fiction that has been so fully realized that he misguides us with a false feeling of our own reality because we are the ones who made him: he is subordinate to us, especially in the art of lying. For the acephalics among us who have said that the Devil’s greatest trick was convincing the world that he did not exist, it must be said back: if he did not exist, then neither would we.
author: Thomas Ligotti, The Conspiracy Against the Human Race

quote: I wasn't living, just existing.
author: Victoria Spry, Tortured: Abused and neglected by Britain's most sadistic mum. This is my story of survival.

quote: The man who carries a parcel is anxious not to lose it -- he is parcel-conscious. The man who cherishes the feeling 'I am' is self-conscious. The jnani holds on to nothing and cannot be said to be conscious. And yet he is not unconscious. He is the very heart of awareness. We call him digambara clothed in space, the Naked One, beyond all appearance. There is no name and shape under which he may be said to exist, yet he is the only one that truly is.
author: Nisargadatta Maharaj

quote: Might it have been nothing but life itself? Life; this limitless complex sea, filled with assorted flotsam, brimming with capricious, violent, and yet eternally transparent blues and greens.
author: Yukio Mishima, Thirst for Love
tags: existence, existential, japanese, japanese-classics, japanese-lit, japanese-literature, mishima, yukio-mishima

quote: I, on the other hand, felt as I always have, like I were water seeping from a broken pot; I existed but had no form to hold me in place.
author: Krishna Udayasankar, Three
tags: broken, devastated, existence, life-challenges, lost, shattered, shattered-souls

quote: Every once in a while, and it happens only several times a year if I am lucky, I will feel astonishment that I exist, that I am sitting, standing, perceiving, and that others perceive me...It is probably a good thing I am not always so aware of my existence because otherwise I would walk about in a haze of wonder embracing things.
author: Meia Geddes, Love Letters to the World

quote: The order of the universe is like a gem with many facets, and we see only one, that which reflects the existence of our own world.
author: Raymond E. Feist, Rage of a Demon King

quote: A million coincidences had to occur in order for you to exist
author: Dan Howell and Phil Lester

quote: Although this was not a comforting point of view, he did not reject it, because it coincided with one of his basic beliefs: that a man must at all costs keep some part of himself outside and beyond life. If he should ever for an instant cease doubting, accept wholly the truth of what his senses conveyed to him, he would be dislodged from the solid ground to which he clung and swept along with the current, having lost all objective sense, totally involved with existence.
author: Paul Bowles, The Spider's House
tags: empirical, existence, immersion, morocco, objectivity, outsider, senses, stranger, subjectivity, truth

quote: He had a third martini. He looked at me intently and took hold of my arm. 'Look', he said. 'You're a fish in a pond. It's drying up. You have to mutate into an amphibian, but someone keeps hanging on to you and telling you to stay in the pond, everything's going to be all right.
author: Jack Kerouac, And the Hippos Were Boiled in Their Tanks

quote: The question of being is the darkest in all philosophy.
author: William James, Some Problems of Philosophy: A Beginning of an Introduction to Philosophy

quote: Enjoy the time of existence.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Close your eyes because all the great sounds of existence can best be heard with eyes shut!
author: Mehmet Murat ildan

quote: For you to exist on earth, downplay on the religious factor.
author: Sunday Adelaja

quote: There are things we do automatically, our body, acting on its own, avoids inconvenience whenever possible, that is why we sleep on the eve of battle or execution, and why ultimately we die when we can no longer bear the harsh light of existence.
author: José Saramago, The Year of the Death of Ricardo Reis

quote: Who can live without eating? A farmer is a great hero because he fights for our existence! If anyone deserves a medal of existence in a country, that person should be a farmer!
author: Mehmet Murat ildan

quote: After that, we were like flies stuck in honey, alive but not really living.
author: Martha Hall Kelly, Lilac Girls
tags: existence, life-changing, lifeless, living-life, oppression, terror

quote: Nihilists embrace life's existence by the acceptance of nothingness
author: Martijn Budel

quote: I am a cypher...I carry no weight, no worth, no influence. I represent nothing. I do not exist.
author: Brunonia Barry, The Fifth Petal
